author: Special Correspondent
text:
Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) Puducherry unit president, V. Saminathan and party MLA M. Visweswaran on Sunday apprised of the political development to national president Amit Shah in New Delhi in view of the forthcoming Assembly elections in UT.

They greeted Mr. Shah for being elected as president for second term. They met Union Minister of State Prakash Javadekar and Union Minister Piyush Goyal who were recently appointed BJP election in-charge for the poll-bound States including Union Territory of Puducherry.

Talking to The Hindu , Mr. Saminathan said, “We apprised our leaders of the political situation and gave our opinions on forging alliances. They said BJP party should be strengthened so as to get substantial number of votes and MLAs in the forthcoming polls.”

He added that the party had planned to conduct District Level Conferences where the Union Ministers are likely to participate.
title: Amit Shah apprised of political developments
